Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 41 for SLE 15 SP2)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 41 for SLE 15 SP2)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 5.3.18-150200_24_166 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2023-2163: Fixed an incorrect verifier pruning in BPF that could lead to unsafe code paths being incorrectly marked as safe, resulting in arbitrary read/write in kernel memory, lateral privilege escalation, and container escape. (bsc#1215519)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 15 SP2

Vulnerabilities.Description:
Incorrect verifier pruning in BPF in Linux Kernel >=5.4 leads to unsafe
code paths being incorrectly marked as safe, resulting in arbitrary read/write in
kernel memory, lateral privilege escalation, and container escape.
